column4: i have apache2 and php installed, but it doesn't work when I point the browser to localhost/drupal/index.php ... what module am I missing?
apache is working fine otherwise
is /drupal/index.php inside your wwwroot?
and what error you get?
then your php5 installation is broken
or apache doesnt know how to handle php files
check your apache config, it should have a line for php handling
ls -la /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5*
yes
cat /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5.conf (pastebin)
cat /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5.load (pastebin)
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
already didd that a few times
whos the owner of the php file?
chown to www-data or whatever user runs apache
still no luck, weird, same install worked yesterday...
should something be in /etc/apache2/apache2.conf?
no not empty, but no mention of php5
it's ok
I jsut rebooted, no change, apache refuses to parse the php5
apache2ctl -M lists php5_module as well
WTF? it works from another machine
it's a firefox problem, with konqueror it works.
